rComments: The absolute BEST professor at UoT. This prof is a treasure, who actually engages his students and cares! Be prepared to write a lot, but you will actually enjoy this accounting course, he also has some pretty good jokes. Not sure what UoT pays this guy but they should triple it. Take his section , thank me later.

GET READY TO WRITE! Beware this course. Assignments are brutally long and the course itself was ridiculous. Amernic was chill but he was more of a facilitator and this course was really a learn by doing course.
teacherRatingTags: ['So many papers', 'Clear grading criteria', 'Lots of homework']

rComments: Amernic is chill. He tells you what he looks for when he grades the writing assignments. Didn't learn much from his lecture slides but it was an easy course and he makes it enjoyable.

One of the best professors in all of U of T, his assignments and exam require more abstract reasoning and analysis instead of traditional technical mastery in accounting. He engages the class and provides excellent examples, definitely worth taking and learning from.
Others have pretty much said it all. Best prof at Rotman and a wonderful human being.

Amazing Prof, completely unlike any other accounting course you will take. After 2 years of learning the how, Amernic teaches you Why, and So what? The amount of interactivity and real world experience is unparalleled. Take his session, no matter what.

Prof. Amernic is probably the best professor in Commerce at U of T. His classes were an amazing experience. He is very helpful both as a professor and a mentor. I have often gone to him for advice. U of T students are very, very lucky to have this guy as a professor. Definietly, my favourite professor at U of T!

The 8/15/05 rating for Prof Amernic is applicable to Profs Cuervo and Reid, not Amernic.  I liked his teaching and helpful explanations for the 1st assignment.  He shows how his passion for accounting in his teaching.  The only downside to this course was the lack of emphasis on non-Canadian, non-American companies e.g. Livedoor, Renault.
U of T students are fortunate to have such a great professor.

I give him credit for his enthusiasm, but I got a B+ on my assgmt. And I asked him why, because grading comments were missing and there was the mark alone. And he looked in the sky and said firmly "It's a B+". No comments.

Amernic is the best Prof I have ever had at UofT. He genuinely cares about the students and he makes the topics he teaches interesting and he is always very enthusiastic. Ask for help if you need it and work hard as he knows when you make the effort and when you don't
Did not enjoy taking the course.  The lectures have no structure and is everywhere.  The answers he answers are very vague.

Although the materials could be hard, but he's nevertheless an extremely friendly prof.  If you work hard, you'll do fine.  But don't aim for a 4.0, you'll be disappointed.  Go to office hours, he could be extremely helpful to you.
Depth and breadth of accounting knowledge that only comes with experience. Yet somehow still excited to be teaching.
An excellent accounting professor.  I really enjoy listening to him
he's such an enthusiastic and knowledgable prof, really cares about his students
